item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美联储加息观点成为焦点，股市强劲增长的一年即将结束
item.description: 美股今年的辉煌业绩将在下周的美联储会议上接受最后一次重大考验，投资者将等待央行的降息指引。【原文：A banner year for U.S. stocks gets one of its last big tests with the coming week’s Federal Reserve meeting, as investors await the central bank's guidance on interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将审理有关加州尾气排放和电动汽车标准的争议
item.description: 美国最高法院周五同意听取燃料生产商的诉讼请求，根据联邦空气污染法对加利福尼亚州的汽车排放和电动汽车标准提出质疑。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Friday to hear a bid by fuel producers to challenge California's standards for vehicle emissions and electric cars under a federal air pollution law in a major case testing the Democratic-governed state's power to fight greenhouse gases.】

item.title: 加拿大表示，如果美国加征关税，加拿大将作出有力回应
item.description: 加拿大财政部长克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）周五表示，如果即将上任的美国政府一意孤行，承诺对从加拿大进口的商品征收关税，渥太华和加拿大各省将做出强有力的回应。【原文：Ottawa and the provinces will respond robustly if the incoming U.S. administration goes ahead with a promise to impose tariffs on imports from Canada, Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士：主要云提供商可能在美国以外地区的人工智能芯片接入中扮演关键角色
item.description: 两位熟悉该计划草案的人士说，在对中国政府的最新嘲讽中，美国将授权谷歌和微软等公司在全球范围内充当把关人，以获取备受追捧的人工智能芯片。【原文：In its latest jab at Beijing, the U.S. will empower companies like Google and Microsoft to act as gatekeepers worldwide for highly sought-after access to AI chips, two people familiar with the draft plan said.】

item.title: 蒙特利尔银行从摩根大通聘请 Sciarrino 担任美国商业银行部主管-备忘录
item.description: 根据周五内部发出的一份备忘录，蒙特利尔银行将聘请摩根大通的 Tony Sciarrino 领导其美国商业银行业务，接替将于 1 月 1 日退休的 Ray Whitacre。【原文：Bank of Montreal is hiring Tony Sciarrino from JPMorgan Chase to lead its U.S. commercial banking business, replacing Ray Whitacre who will retire Jan. 1, according to a memo sent internally on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道Databricks 接近创纪录的 95 亿美元 VC 融资，目标是额外 45 亿美元债务
item.description: 三位消息人士周五透露，软件公司Databricks即将达成一笔交易，这可能成为历史上规模最大的一轮风险投资，因为投资者对拥有这家快速增长的数据分析公司的股份表现出了强烈的愿望。【原文：Software firm Databricks is nearing a deal that could become one of the largest venture capital funding rounds in history, as investors have shown a strong appetite to own a piece of the fast-growing data analytics firm, three sources said on Friday.】

item.title: 可口可乐投资约 9000 万美元扩大巴西亚马孙地区的生产规模
item.description: 巴西可口可乐公司在一份声明中说，该公司投资 5.5 亿雷亚尔（9100 万美元）扩建位于巴西亚马孙州的一家浓缩饮料厂。【原文：Coca-Cola Brasil invested 550 million reais ($91 million) to expand a concentrate beverage plant in the Brazilian state of Amazonas, the company said in a statement.】

item.title: Liquid AI 完成 2.5 亿美元早期融资，AMD 领投
item.description: 生成式人工智能初创公司 Liquid AI 周五表示，该公司已完成 2.5 亿美元的早期融资，领投方为芯片制造商 Advanced Micro Devices，后者也是该公司的战略合作伙伴。【原文：Generative artificial intelligence startup Liquid AI said on Friday that it had closed a $250 million early-stage funding round led by chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices , which is also its strategic partner.】

item.title: 美国众议院小组发现贝莱德和其他资产管理公司对加入气候倡议持谨慎态度
item.description: 据共和党领导的美国国会委员会周五发布的一份报告称，美国顶级资产管理公司担心，签署一项行业气候倡议可能会使他们显得合作过于紧密，从而招致监管审查。【原文：Top U.S. asset managers worried that signing up to an industry climate initiative could make them appear to be working too closely together and draw regulatory scrutiny, according to a report released Friday by a Republican-led U.S. Congressional Committee.】

item.title: 大众汽车第一大股东保时捷 SE 认为投资减值高达 200 亿欧元
item.description: 拥有大众汽车三分之一股份的控股公司保时捷 SE 周五表示，预计其对大众汽车的投资将减值达 200 亿欧元（209.8 亿美元）。【原文：Porsche SE , the holding company which owns a third of Volkswagen , expects an impairment on its investment in the carmaker of up to 20 billion euros ($20.98 billion), it said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，俄罗斯诺瓦泰克公司雇佣游说者以解冻与美国的关系
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，俄罗斯最大的液化天然气生产商诺瓦泰克公司正在与游说者合作，试图在华盛顿对其庞大的北极液化天然气 2 项目实施制裁后重建与美国的关系。【原文：Russia's largest liquefied natural gas producer Novatek is working with lobbyists in an attempt to rebuild U.S. relations after Washington imposed sanctions on its mammoth Arctic LNG 2 project, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 地方工会呼吁克罗格董事会在实施 75 亿美元回购计划后更换首席执行官
item.description: 克罗格公司在终止收购 Albertsons 的交易后宣布了一项价值 75 亿美元的股票回购计划，食品与商业联合工会（United Food and Commercial Workers）地方工会周五敦促克罗格公司董事会撤换首席执行官罗德尼-麦克马伦（Rodney McMullen）。【原文：United Food and Commercial Workers local unions on Friday urged Kroger's board to replace CEO Rodney McMullen following the company's announcement of a $7.5 billion stock buyback plan after terminating a deal to buy Albertsons .】

item.title: 美国立法者要求苹果和谷歌做好准备，于 1 月 19 日将 TikTok 从应用程序商店中删除
item.description: 美国众议院中国问题委员会主席和最高民主党人周五告诉谷歌母公司 Alphabet 和苹果公司的首席执行官，他们必须准备好在 1 月 19 日将 TikTok 从其美国应用程序商店中移除。【原文：The chair and top Democrat on a U.S. House of Representatives committee on China on Friday told the CEOs of Google-parent Alphabet and Apple they must be ready to remove TikTok from their U.S. app stores on Jan. 19.】

item.title: 特朗普顾问报告称，放松银行业监管的计划可能无法获得所需支持
item.description: 有报道称，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的过渡团队计划大幅缩减或取消银行业最高监管机构，但美国银行股对此反应平平，因为华尔街预计此举不会获得所需的政治支持。【原文：U.S. bank stocks showed little reaction to a report that President-elect Donald Trump's transition team was planning to severely shrink or eliminate top banking regulators as Wall Street does not expect such a move to receive the required political backing.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国证交会已延长马斯克回应推特调查和解提议的时限
item.description: 一位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）已经推迟了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）回应其提议的最后期限，以解决对这位亿万富翁在2022年以440亿美元收购推特（Twitter）的调查。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has pushed back a deadline for Elon Musk to respond to its offer to resolve an inquiry into the billionaire' s $44-billion takeover of Twitter in 2022, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 菲利普-莫里斯公司将支付 120 万美元，以了结对违反香精烟草禁令的调查
item.description: 烟草巨头菲利普莫里斯国际公司（Philip Morris International）的子公司瑞典火柴北美公司（SMNA）将支付 120 万美元，以了结对违反华盛顿特区调味烟草禁令的调查。【原文：Tobacco giant Philip Morris International's subsidiary Swedish Match North America(SMNA) will pay $1.2 million to settle an investigation into violations of Washington D.C.'s flavored tobacco ban.】

item.title: 墨西哥监管机构裁定沃尔玛采用垄断做法，并下令罚款
item.description: 墨西哥反垄断监督机构 Cofece 上周五发表声明称，美国零售巨头沃尔玛在墨西哥的子公司 Walmex 被裁定在供应商方面存在垄断行为。【原文：Mexico's antitrust watchdog Cofece ruled that Walmex , the local unit of U.S.-based retail giant Walmart , engaged in a monopolistic practice related to its suppliers, the company said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 咨询公司麦肯锡支付 6.5 亿美元解决美国阿片类药物调查问题
item.description: 麦肯锡公司（McKinsey & Co）已同意支付 6.5 亿美元，以解决美国司法部对该咨询公司为阿片类药物生产商奥施康定（OxyContin）生产商普渡制药公司（Purdue Pharma）就如何提高销售额提供咨询的调查。【原文：McKinsey & Co has agreed to pay $650 million to resolve a U.S. Department of Justice investigation into the consulting firm's work advising opioid manufacturer OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma on how to boost sales.】

item.title: 美国众议院新任银行业主席希望将 "钙化 "从法规中剔除
item.description: 美国众议院银行委员会新任主席周五表示，他将在 1 月份召开的下一届国会上寻求消除 "钙化"，减少对银行业的监管，这表明他与即将上任的总统唐纳德-特朗普的立场一致。【原文：The U.S. House banking committee's incoming chair said on Friday he would seek to remove "calcification" and reduce regulations in the sector when the next Congress convenes in January, showing an alignment with incoming President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 美国 11 月进口价格勉强上涨
item.description: 由于美元走强，11 月份美国进口价格几乎没有上涨，因为食品和燃料成本的上涨被其他方面的下降部分抵消，这表明未来几个月通胀压力可能会减弱。【原文：U.S. import prices barely rose in November as increases in the costs of food and fuels were partially offset by decreases elsewhere, thanks to a strong dollar and suggesting that inflation pressures could subside in the months ahead.】

item.title: 土耳其以违反竞争法为由对谷歌罚款 7500 万美元
item.description: 土耳其竞争管理机构周五发表声明称，对 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌公司罚款 26.1 亿里拉（约合 7500 万美元），原因是该公司利用其在广告服务器服务市场的主导地位。【原文：Turkey's competition authority has fined Alphabet Inc's Google 2.61 billion lira ($75 million), for taking advantage of its dominant position in ad server services market, the regulator said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 受美联储降息预期影响，美国股票基金获得第六周资金流入
item.description: 截至12月11日，美国投资者连续第六周抢购股票基金，原因是在劳动力市场放缓和通胀降温迹象的刺激下，美联储可能在即将召开的会议上降息。【原文：U.S. investors snapped up equity funds for a sixth consecutive week through Dec. 11, spurred by the potential for a Federal Reserve interest rate cut at the upcoming meeting, amid signs of a moderating labor market and cooling inflation.】

item.title: 高盛获得中国基金销售许可
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）获得监管部门批准在中国销售基金，这是最新一家获得金融许可证的美国投资银行，表明中国政府承诺继续向外国公司开放金融业。【原文：Goldman Sachs received regulatory approval to sell funds in China, the latest U.S. investment bank to get a financial licence in a sign of Beijing's commitment to continue opening up the sector to foreign companies.】

item.title: 美联储降息预期升温，全球股票基金每周资金流入强劲
item.description: 截至12月11日，全球股票基金连续第11周吸引资金流入，原因是有迹象表明，美国劳动力市场降温和消费者价格稳定可能有助于美联储本月连续第三次降息。【原文：Global equity funds attracted inflows for an 11th successive week through Dec. 11, supported by signs that a cooling U.S. labor market and stable consumer prices might facilitate a third consecutive rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 英国法院恢复马来西亚工人对戴森公司的诉讼
item.description: 周五，英国上诉法院裁定，二十多名声称在一家马来西亚工厂为英国真空吸尘器制造商戴森制造零部件时遭到强迫劳动的移民工人可以在伦敦起诉戴森公司。【原文：Two dozen migrant workers who allege they were subjected to forced labour at a Malaysian factory while making parts for British vacuum cleaner manufacturer Dyson can sue the company in London, the Court of Appeal ruled on Friday.】

item.title: 英国竞争监管机构对 Blackrock-Preqin 的 32.2 亿美元交易展开调查
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周五表示，正在对资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）以 25.5 亿英镑（32.2 亿美元）收购英国数据公司 Preqin 的交易展开调查。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Friday it was launching a probe into asset management firm BlackRock's 2.55 billion pounds ($3.22 billion) acquisition of UK data firm Preqin.】

item.title: 塔瓦雷斯说，斯特兰蒂斯的 "友好 "退出是由于在战略上的分歧
item.description: 卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）于12月1日突然辞去汽车制造商Stellantis首席执行官一职，他在周四晚些时候发表的一篇访谈中表示，他 "友好 "离职的原因是与董事会在战略上存在分歧。【原文：Carlos Tavares, who abruptly resigned as CEO of carmaker Stellantis on Dec. 1, said his "amicable" departure was motivated by disagreements with the board over strategy, in an interview published late on Thursday.】

item.title: 博通因预测人工智能芯片需求激增而大涨
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）预测未来几年对其定制人工智能芯片的需求将持续上升，该公司股价周五飙升14%，市值接近1万亿美元。【原文：Shares of Broadcom soared 14% on Friday, with the chipmaker moving closer to $1 trillion in market value after it forecast that demand for its custom AI chips would keep rising in the coming years.】

item.title: 蒙古欺诈案后，特拉菲古拉净利润和股本减少
item.description: 全球大宗商品贸易公司创辉集团（Trafigura）周五表示，由于在蒙古发现了价值数十亿美元的石油欺诈案，该公司2024年的盈利大幅下降，并下调了前几年的股本和利润。【原文：Global commodity trading house Trafigura saw a sharp drop in its earnings for 2024 and has revised down its equity and profits for previous years after it discovered a billion-dollar oil fraud in Mongolia, the company said on Friday.】

item.title: T-Mobile 宣布 140 亿美元回购
item.description: 电信巨头 T-Mobile 周五公布了 140 亿美元的股票回购计划。【原文：Telecom giant T-Mobile unveiled a $14 billion share buyback on Friday.】
